links.title: WineHQ - About Wine
links.description:
Wine (originally an acronym for "Wine Is Not an Emulator") is a
compatibility layer capable of running Windows applications on several
POSIX-compliant operating systems, such as Linux, macOS, & BSD.
Instead of simulating internal Windows logic like a virtual machine or
emulator, Wine translates Windows API calls into POSIX calls on-the-fly,
eliminating the performance and memory penalties of other methods and
allowing you to cleanly integrate Win...

Peirce's Sign Theory, or Semiotic, is an account of signification,
representation, reference and meaning. Although sign theories have a
long history, Peirce's accounts are distinctive and innovative for
their breadth and complexity, and for capturing the importance of
interpretation to signification. For Peirce, developing a
thoroughgoing theory of signs was a central philosophical and
intellectual preoccupation. The importance of semiotic for ...

links.title: Coroutines (C++20) - cppreference.com
links.description: A coroutine is a function that can suspend execution to be resumed later. Coroutines are stackless: they suspend execution by returning to the caller and the data that is required to resume execution is stored separately from the stack. This allows for sequential code that executes asynchronously (e.g. to handle non-blocking I/O without explicit callbacks), and also supports algorithms on lazy-computed infinite sequences and other uses.
